abstract.p: This paper presents a model to explore the relationship between the systematic risk of a security and the characteristics of the underlying real assets. A corporate manager can use this model to estimate whether the beta coefficient of the firm's equity has changed and, if so, by how much, or to estimate how a proposed change in operating or financial policies may affect the market value and beta coefficient of equity. A major advantage of the model is that it permits systematic predictions (consistent with the CAPM) of the relationship between a change in a characteristic of an asset and changes in its risk, its market value, and its expected rate of return.
